overview: The new 'Files changed' experience in pull requests receives CODEOWNERS validation, significant performance improvements (up to 67% faster interactions for large PRs), small screen layout fixes, and multiple bug fixes for notifications, sticky headers, and comment rendering.

detailed_explanation.title: CODEOWNERS validation
bullets: CODEOWNERS validation has been added to the new 'Files changed' experience, filling a gap from the classic view.
Required reviewers are now correctly surfaced based on CODEOWNERS rules, ensuring review requirements are enforced before merge.

detailed_explanation.title: Small screen improvements
bullets: Multiple layout, spacing, and overflow issues fixed for mobile and smaller viewports.
Diffs, comments, headers, and controls now render and behave correctly on small screens.

detailed_explanation.title: Performance improvements
bullets: Pull request diffs optimized for greater responsiveness: early data shows up to 67% faster interactions for large PRs.
Virtualization now applied only to the largest PRs for scrolling and interaction performance.
Navigation between Conversations and Files tabs improved from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
File tree resizing is smoother and more responsive.
Improved performance and stability in Safari.
Fixed high memory usage when reviewing large PRs.

detailed_explanation.title: Bug fixes
bullets: Opening a notification into Files changed now correctly marks the notification as read.
File diff header is now consistently sticky when scrolling.
Code snippets in thread replies no longer have an indistinguishable background color.
Fixed an error when commenting across large index differences in diffs.

key_changes: CODEOWNERS validation added to the new 'Files changed' experience.
Up to 67% faster interactions for large pull requests.
Conversations-to-Files tab navigation reduced from 10+ seconds to a few seconds.
Virtualization applied selectively only to the largest PRs.
Small screen layout and overflow fixes for mobile viewports.
Four specific bug fixes for notifications, sticky headers, code snippet styling, and large diff commenting.
impact: Teams using CODEOWNERS rules will see accurate review requirements enforced in the new Files changed view.
Developers reviewing large pull requests experience significantly faster interactions and lower memory usage.
Mobile and small-screen users benefit from corrected layouts and controls.
Safari users get improved stability when reviewing PRs.
caveats: Virtualization for performance is applied only to the largest pull requests; smaller PRs use standard rendering.
These improvements are part of the new 'Files changed' experience, which is in preview; the classic view remains available.
Specific thresholds for what constitutes a 'large' pull request are not stated in the article.
insights: The 67% improvement and 10+ seconds to a few seconds metrics indicate that performance was a significant pain point in the new experience.
Selective virtualization shows a targeted approach: avoiding unnecessary complexity for smaller PRs while addressing lag for large ones.
The addition of CODEOWNERS validation is likely a prerequisite for broader adoption of the new Files changed view.
